review: Let me start by saying, that it was freezing in this establishment. When I bring it to the attention of staff, it was told to me that has been this way for the past 3 weeks. Then , I order appetizers... pop stickers always come with some sort of roughage such as salad and because it was half price it came without it. I ordered a cup of coffee, and I actually stuck my finger inside of it , that's how cold it was. When my order was brung to the table, the waiter did not remove the appetizer plates leaving us cramped up with our platters and empty dishes. Overall service was horrible. I felt like I was having dinner in the North Pole. Strongly would not suggest this location.

This place is falling apart, bathroom is broken  The staff is trying their best, but you can tell they are poorly trained, today Saturday lunch time almost empty  Nobody is watching o taken charge Food ok  My son dropped his soda, nobody is mopping the soda  Horrible

This is probably the most disgusting place I have ever been to. I understand if there had been a rush that just left and the place was a bit disorganized but it seemed like there was no one there for a while and the place had not been cleaned since they opened in the morning. No issues with service because we didn't even get to that point. The host pointed us to a booth, there was ketchup on the booth and food residue from the previous table where he place the menus.  The floor had so much dirt in it it was hard to walk by and not notice how disgusting everything was. As we walked towards our booth we looked at all the tables, everything so disgustingly dirty OMG. How has the health department not closed this down???
Came for lunch with my boyfriend . Listen I wasn't expecting classy place but cmon . I never felt more like a bother in my life . Won't come back

I came here with a business colleague this evening for dinner. It was rainy Sunday late afternoon and not that busy. Although we were seated quickly it took someone from the waitstaff 15 minutes to come and take our order. When the waiter finally came he took our drink and food orders at the same time. It took forever to bring our drinks and water. The appetizer I ordered was good (green bean fries) but then it took a while to get our food and when we finally got it it was barely warm. While waiting we notice some questionable things; ice buckets sitting out in the open for dust and hair or whatever else to fall into; waitstaff talking and checking their phones while supposed to be working; another table next to us the waiter got their order wrong and they were complaining; then someone came in and was asking for the manager because he was waiting almost 30 minutes for a pick up order he placed over the phone. He asked to speak to the manager and was very upset. On top of our observations, our waiter neglected to ask us if we were ok or if we wanted more water and when he asked if we wanted a second round of drinks he asked for ID, but never got it from us when we ordered our first round of drinks, smh. I love Friday's but this was a bad experience. Maybe today was a bad day to go but I won't be going to this location again, ever.

This was the worst experience I have ever had in a restaurant. The waiters were nasty and taking forever. They dropped other people's plates when giving the customer's their food. The waitress had a nasty attitude. She sneezed on my mom. The last straw was when the waitress carried 4 of our cups without a tray holding them against her breasts. Worst service ever. I felt like i was going to eat in a homeless shelter. We picked up and left because we were afraid of how the food would arrive seeing how nasty and uncleanly the staff was. Never going here again.
The food was ok for the price! Ample parking, plenty of seating, and the food came quickly! Eat at the bar!

Ordered delivery 3 times now, and 3 times food was so late it arrived ice cold. Delivery estimate was for an hour at the time of ordering.  Then it increased to an hour, 10 minutes.  Food finally arrived an hour and a half later. Unfortunately, it was all so cold, it wasn't enjoyable at all.

My waiter was so rude and unprofessional. All the employees were hanging around talking with one another instead of attending to the guest. TGI Fridays needs to start hiring professional employees instead of hood rats off the street. Wont be here AGAIN!
Our server is george, and i think he should get awarded for employee of the month, he is so polite, his customer service skill is simply excellent. Food was delicious as usual.

This was the worst fridays experience ever. The waiter basically threw the menus down on the table and didn't greet us. She said give her one minute like twice and never came to take our order. She was ghetto!!! We ended up walking out because of this poor service. Get I.T. together.

We waited  for a half hour for our food at the bar which  the food was cold. We asked for water when we sat down and received it an hour and twenty minutes later. Needless to say I'm going to kick my friends ass " let's go to Friday's, I love Fridays, haven't been there in forever she says with her happy Disney acting ass. Took my son here for lunch i got a burger he got chicken fingers. Fridays is usually a really chill spot to hangout and have a few drinks any reason to drink and eat good food is a great reason.
This place smells disgusting and their employees think it smells like roses. Don't come here unless you want to enjoy the scent of dirty old mops.

I use to enjoy coming here instead of gun hill but last couple of visits it's been like a sinking ship. I went there with my son figured no one was there a quick in and out there should be minimal wait time for the food to come out. Proven wrong again my kid ordered chicken tenders and fries and pot stickers and i had to mention to the waitress bring his food first because he was hungry and yet still mines came out first anyway and that was still disappointing . My family and I  were on our way back to Maryland, we stopped here to grab a bite, place had little to no customers but we still had a twenty minute wait. Waiter was cool, but slow, what really stuck out about this establishment, was the amount of filth on the nearby tables and the floor. It was like the wait staff was on a permanent smoke break. Cmon New York, I expected better.

Although the staff seems nice, the service is slow and inefficient.  Four of us walked in, but we kept getting served for only three.  We ordered a frozen drink and it took as asking about said drink 20 minutes later before the wait staff bothered to mention that the blender was broken. After ordering a non frozen drink, it never arrived.  I'm not sure if it's ineptness or downright belligerence.

Dont forget to get the new app chipped plates. These are great. This is un profesional. Doesnt matter if its a smaller chip that cant be seen. Should be replaced. Imagine the chipped piece of plate was lodged in a chicken wing.

This is probably the easiest go to restaurant in Cross County Shopping Center. I stopped in for a quick lunch before work and was seated at the high top tables at the bar. After being seated I had been approached by an employee who informed me that the server serving me would be coming in between 7 and 15 minutes, so I was given the option to wait or sit at the bar, mind you I was on a tight time schedule. I moved to the bar and the food came out about 15-25 minutes, yet all I ordered was mozzarella sticks and sliders. The mozzarella sticks marinara sauce was dry and the buns of the burger were hard. Definitely need a better team structure and management staff to pull it all together.
Do not come to this TGIF. Service was terrible and the manager would not come out to rectify the issue. Very disappointed.
Worse service  Food comes 1 hour later  And food comes cold .   Then the manager only accommodates for 1 drink
Awesome severe, waiter was great even on a busy day. A little bit of a wait time but it was as expect because it was a busy Saturday night.

Can I give it no stars?  Omg.  Where do I begin.  The place was dirty, service was horrendous and the food was just as bad.  Then to top off our fine dining experience, we were greeted by 2 RATS ON THE PATHWAY LEAVING THE RESTAURANT.  NO LIE.  STAY AWAY

Worst Fridays I've ever been. I saw all the bad reviews, and I thought "maybe won't happen to me," but I was wrong... They have some serious food quality issues here. I've waited excessively long. They ruined my sister's birthday...

Not all TGI Fridays are bad but this location in Cross County was very different. First let me say that we were seated in the bar area. When I tell you that the waitress behaved like she didn't want to be there that would be an understatement. We ordered our food and drinks. First of all, she slammed the small plates with napkins on the table. The delivery of the drinks was with the same attitude. Lets not talk about the delivery of the food - we waited and waited and waited and waited. People that came in after us received their food and we were still waiting. The waitress never came back to say anything - at first I thought she went home. I had to ask another waiter to go get my waitress and my goodness she really had no personality. She definitely wasn't trained in customer service. When I inquired about my food order she stated that it was coming - I was saying it's almost an hour. If I wasn't hungry I would have left. When my food finally arrived I really didn't want it but I tried to make the best of it. When it came time for the check I just looked on the handheld device that they had on the table and got my total and called her over and paid in cash. When I think about it I should have used my debit card on that device and paid and left I'm sure she wouldn't have noticed that we left. I recommend that the mangers do a better job at training their wait staff because I'm sure this is not the first time this happened. I gave them 3 stars for the food not the service - sorry TGIF in Cross County - you're not there yet

Service slow and unorganized. Incomplete/broken menus. Dirty cups (my cup had hard green streak on it) Air condition wasn't working on a hot day. Small portions. Chicken served on piece of wood and splinters from the wood were in my mash potatoes.

Wow how horrible. So after 45 minute wait for food this is what they bring out. Cold late and to add insult to injury we complain that the order is not complete apparently the waitress says she put it in the system so we should wait an additional 30 mins for beans and the wrap and then she takes the next order. sweetheart if you cant get mine correct why are you taking another. The manager wearing a blue jacket came out said im sorry ill send everything right out after 20 mins we decided to leave i said just bill me for what we ate he sends out a bill for the items i never got only after i complained was it taken off. What i shame i really loved this place.

Zero stars for this location. 20 minutes to be seated when there were empty tables. Took forever to get water and then more time to get order taken.  Appetizers never came after 30 minutes and others were seated after us and had theirs. Very bad vibe. We left.  I'm only going to the one on Central Ave from now on.
Do not waste your money.  Cobb salad faded,. Bacon in the salad dripping with deep fryer grease, same with the onion rings.

Coming in on a Friday afternoon there was no wait time. I was unaware that there was outside seating, I wish we would have been seated outside but its ok next time. The tables now have a tablet that you can order certain foods and drinks on them! They even have games for 1.99 each for children! The tablets also have a bell where you can call the server over which is neat.  The menu was fun it had a lot of pictures of certain dishes. They offer children a page to color with crayons. I ordered the Jack Daniels New York Strip with fried shrimp and two sides of fries. WELL, one server told me i got the flat iron instead but my server insisted it was the new york strip. I have ordered this before and it was definitely the flat iron. I got one side of fries and the shrimp is the only thing that came right in that order. They forgot the Jack Daniels sauce with my meal.  The food was good, fries are crispy, and steak was flat so it wasn't juicy! I always love fried shrimp!  When it came to the bill they tried to charge me TWICE for the shrimp on the bill. I told the server she immediately took the extra charge off the bill. The server was nice. I just knew that they gave me the wrong order, charged twice and they charged me for a new york strip instead of the flat iron (flat iron was much cheaper).  I was not impressed with the service and not only was the order wrong but the bill was wrong and if i did not check the bill that would of sucked.

Terrible service the place wasn't even full and we had to wait an hour and a half to even get drinks because apparently they "didn't have any clean cups". Our food never came and when we asked for the manager he gave us attitude. Around ten to twenty minutes later we called our waitress so they can at least bring us our silverware however when she arrived we asked about the food and that for some reason upset her I guess because she threw the "silverware" on our table. Another complaint I have is they gave us plastic sporks like any fast food chain not like the restaurant they appear to be. We finally had enough and decided to leave and at the door we discovered another group of around six people leaving because of the poor service and they even told us that they saw around three other smaller groups leaving also. My father decided to go back and voice his complaints to the manager and asked security to get him but he was dealing with a already complaining client at the bar, he didn't even show face to my father. Terrible service. And the drinks that took over an hour to arrive...my lemonade was watered down to nothing.

OK, most of these chain restaurants all have decent food. I didn't come here expecting to be blown away but did want everything to be cooked well. I had to cut the edges of the ones I ate bc they were not cooked, it's like somehow they only managed to cook the middle.  The Jack Daniels sliders were only tasty after I asked for a side of the sauce and dunk it before every bit.  The chicken fingers were the star since they tasted the way they should have along with the fries. This is why I try to pick a family owned restaurant when going out for food since you know they will put some love in preparing your food. I will say the staff was pretty nice and attentive.

Not sure why I keep giving this place a chance. So let's start by saying... staff here definitely need training. Last time I came our server wanted to joke around with other staff instead of tending to our table(which took him 25mins to even acknowledge us)... this time around the sarcastic server lacks proper training yet again.... professionally. Bless her heart she tried. But word to the wise do not refer to a woman as "sweetie" or "honey" and her date as "sir" and "mister". Bad look and quite disrespectful. As we sat patiently waiting for our food. We watched as 4 staff members attempted to pick something floating out of a customers drink before bring it to the table (see attached photo)All this to avoid making another drink. It's run down... staff isn't professional or trained and management is no where in sight. LIKE EVER!!! Oh wait. There he is. Watching the game... smh. I DO NOT RECOMMEND SPENDING YOUR HARD EARNED MONEY HERE AT ALL!!!!

As soon as I got to the hostess desk...,had to wait 15 minutes only to be met with a young man who was dragging his feet and didn't appear to like his job that much .  We had to ice-skate on the greasy floor on the way to our table. Wow this place is a mess! almost hr waiting no sign of my food yet. Idk if not well trained or under staffed but this is bad haha.

Where do I begin first we were told there was a 15-minute wait that's not the problem however the restaurant was empty and there were available tables once we get our table the waitress takes our order ask for a specific drink something Hawaiian taste like it was just fruit punch with a lot of ice the waitress took it back to bring me a Long Island iced tea which was not served in his typical glass but more like a shot glass with a lot of ice ordered ribs and lobster the Lobster was  extremely salty and rubbery ribs were okay and  potato was okay think the whole meal was overpriced and then I did not tip because I did not like the food and there was minimum service provided by the waitress

I come here all the time. The drinks and food are really cheap. Happy hour is pretty good. The drinks are ok at this location but could be way better. Depends who is bartending, some of them can be inattentive.

Our experience here was so good last week that we headed back to TGIFRIDAYS last night. Our server, Mark, was attentive and made sure that we had everything that we needed. we ordered the ribeye steaks and a rack of ribs. The ribs were tender and so were the steaks...except mine. I think they made a mistake in the kitchen and gave me sirloin. That would have been OK except that the meat tasted bad. I let Mark know and he got Arthur, the manager. Arthur was awesome. He apologized and asked if he could get me something else. I said I would go for another steak. A whole new plate arrived with everything fresh and the steak was great. The service might be slow at times and your food may not be as hot as you would like it to be but the customer service was terrific and the steak was wonderful. Thank you Arthur and Mark for giving us a great dining experience. we will be back there again very soon.
Terrible place. Worst TGI Fridays ever been. I don't know who is doing the franchise... worst management.  Never recommend anyone to go there. Go another Friday's.

We waited about 10 minutes for our drinks, which was the only good thing we had. We were never given glasses of water, even though I asked for some. We then waited about 40 minutes for our entrees (the floor was not busy). The table next to us seemed to have been going through the same wait, since they stood up and left when the food finally did arrive, without touching/eating anything. We hoped the presentation didn't reflect on the taste. Unfortunately, it did. Our steaks were supposed to be medium well, and were over well done, dry, and lacked in flavor. Our lobster was not cooked well either, it was very hard to eat. I planned to order a dessert when I walked in, but decided not to risk it. Everything about the experience was very disappointing. We will never come back to this location.

Wish I could rate it zero stars. 1 star seems like to much for this establishment. The food is trash. Like garbage. I ordered wings and it came to me frozen. I complained and they took it back then they tried putting 2 orders of wings on my receipt ... ? Na. It was pretty hard actually putting money on the table and paying for this type of food. FYI JUST GO TO CHILIS. 10x better . :)

Let me just say, I really do like Friday's. Just not the one in Cross County. The kitchen is extremely understaffed and nobody has experience. Both times I came the food took extremely long to arrive or was forgotten about. The food is always cold, stale or not cooked properly. The Friday's in Scarsdale is WAY better. I will never eat at this Friday's location again. Absolute shit.

Ramon the bartender is fab. He's professio nal, conscientious and well deserving of all and any tips. Ariani on the hand is full of herself, nasty and is not courteous to most female patrons. Male, female, gay or straight; no one wants to be ignored.

Went for happy hour on a Tuesday afternoon. Manager Lucien was helpful and polite. I wish I remembered my bartenders name she was very nice after a bad first experience there they made up for it the second time around. Happy hour prices are unbeatable. Liked their new chicken quesadillas but more chicken and cheese less peppers for next time.
Cross county location: Rude host, orders didn't come out right & no chicken on quesadillas which is 9.50 ... food was cold ... servers had a bad vibe ... CHANGE YOUR STAFF .

Sooo myself and my friends are veterans, right? Navy and Marine Corps. We all served tours on active duty. We all, also, deployed. More than once! We don't see each other often because our lives have taken different roads but we always find a way to meet up every Veterans Day to reminisce. Anyways. We all work and some of us have kids. Veterans Day was on a Wednesday so it's went on like any day. I got out of work and met up with veteran friends at this TGIF because it was away from the city.  Anyways. Long story, short. They stop serving veteran meals at 3pm. We all left and went to Applebee's because they served meals for veterans all day and night. I know it sounds booshie... But I can't help but to remember how I was in Afghanistan.... past 3 pm.... It's called Veterans Day. Not veterans morning and afternoon.  Thanks Yonkers Friday's. Your waitress wasn't even polite. (Shaved head)

Waitress and hostess were horrible. The hostess asked me and my boy friend if we wanted to sit by the bar without telling us it was happy hour. The waitress had a few tables and one of her tables paid for the wrong meal and she was more worried about making the right table for the meal that was already paid for by the other guest that we had to wait for our appetizers that by the time we got them it was cold and our food came out within 5 minutes after receiving our appetizers. The waitress was very unprofessional and very unapologetic.

Terrible service ! Terrible food! Terrible customer service ! Waiter made up his own rules ! Watched a couple next to us get served fast with great service. I guess the black people who dine in don't get the same service. Since when do you not do take out during happy hour ? Please fire everyone & start over. Cross county is a beautiful place but this TGIF does not belong ! I will never come back.

Terrible welcome. Ended up leaving. We were a party of 5, including a high chair. We were offered the bar area but didn't feel it was appropriate. We were then told it was a 20 minute wait. The place was not full. Wish we had taken photos. The staff was less than accommodating and we saw other customers leave before eating. It's Fridays and it's pretty standard. This place did not impress and we will never return.

The only thing good about this place is the happy hour. The service is terrible because the servers are all rude and very inattentive to customers. But when they mess up on your order and keep doing it all throughout, call the manager. They are usually apologetic and offer discounts or coupons for future use. Just go for the drinks at the bar.
Literally waited 10 minutes for a server to come to the table. Only order chicken tenders and Mac and cheese ! Still waiting about 20 minutes so far

If only I could take away this 1 star. I have never in my life had an experience as the one in cross county. The service is non existing. I only saw my waiter twice. Order and the bill. I was seated at a table with no utensils. Then waited 10 mins after my food came to get it. It only took that "short of time" because I physically got up and tracked someone down for it.  The security guard is extreme disrespectful. Our table was next to where he was standing. He continuously called different females out of their names for no reason. He's a bully that probably has no life or friends. The professionalism is not required at this location. I rather the one on gun hill rd.  WILL NEVER RETURN!!!!!

I went to TGIF in cross county  with my co-workers on our lunch break. We were seated pretty quickly. The waitress took a long time to come to us and introduce herself, that was red flag # 1. When she finally came to us we order and told her that we are on lunch and if she could expedite our order quickly, she then told us "I'll try", red flag # 2. One of my co-worker wanted place her dessert order a head of time and when she ask the waitress about the items on the dessert menu the waitress didn't know it and then told her to remind her about her dessert because she will forget, umm what??, red flag # 3. We waited for 40 minutes with no food in sight and all we ordered were 2 salads, an appetizer platter and a hamburger.   We decided we were going to leave, while talking to the waitress her attitude was very nonchalant so we ask for the manager who proceed to apologize and tell us that she see that our ticket time was 12 minutes. Now how is that possible when we have been waiting for our food for 40 minutes. We tell her that we will pay for what's on the table and she brought us a check for everything we order. Common sense would say take off the items of the food that never made it to the table which was damn near everything. We sat in this restaurant for 1 hour and ended up going back to work hungry. A wasted lunch break. This place is the worst and I would even recommend this place to my worst enemy. It is save to say I will never go back to TGIF again, doesn't matter which one. Not my first bad experience with this chain restaurant.

Okay so maybe it was a change in management ? I'm not too sure what happened . For the most part Chris & Ariana did there thing in trying to provide the best customer service. However Lorraine might be new despite this it does not excuse her lack of attention , she seemed not to be into her job. She took our order did not check in on us and simply didn't even notice that it took us 1 hour and 15 minutes to get our wings . She did not help during the process we had to turn to another bartender (Ariana ) and ask her she finally got us the wings. This TGIF location gives franchises a bad name.  It's in a busy mall complex (Cross County) and it has a strong brand name... so they are always busy. The fact that they have a built in base of customers at the mall has allowed them to perform on a sub-par level and not see repercussions to their business.  Let me just start with the line.  We were there about 4pm on a Sunday afternoon and we were told the wait was "about 25 minutes."  OK fine.  The waiting area was filled up with people and even people waiting in the vestibule and outside (in the cold!).  We went inside to use the bathroom and saw that there were TONS of empty tables throughout the place.  Many of them sitting with dirty dishes on them which weren't bussed for 10-30 minutes!  There were more than enough tables to accommodate everyone in the waiting area.  It is either a case of poor time management or understaffing a busy location on a weekend, or most likely both.  Now on to the service.  While we could see all these empty tables, many waiting to be bussed, at any one time there were 2-6 staff members hovering around the hostess stand.  One was the hostess, one was the girl who seats tables.  Then anywhere from 1-3 waitstaff were standing around there talking with the hostess.  And a tall man in a suit who appeared to be a manager but I'm really not sure because I didn't see him managing.   We had a waiter station near our table and several times there were 2-3 waitresses standing there talking for minutes at a time.  Also, when I went into the ladies room, a waitress was standing in there texting on her phone. No wonder they couldn't fill all the tables - all their servers were TOO BUSY to be serving them! The food... We had 3 burgers and a steak.  The burgers were pretty tasty.  The fries definitely old and soggy, which was a shame because they looked like they would have been great if they were fresh.  The steak was pretty good too, not Peter Luger but better than I expected at Fridays.  One burger we ordered was the Philly burger - we asked for it without bacon and bacon jam (?!?) and when it arrived it looked nothing like the picture (I know, no food ever looks like the picture but this was ridiculous.)  We check it and realize that they didn't put the philly steak between the two patties - the entire point of the Philly burger!  So we had to send it back and ask for a new one.  That was kind of a pain but our waiter James did get a new one, properly made, and it looked MUCH better and tasted good too.   Our waiter, James, was actually pretty good, I have no complaints about him.  Friendly and fairly attentive.  I'd recommend he gets a job in a more reputable establishment because this one is managed terribly!   Oh, one other plus, they had half price appetizers so we got two orders of Buffalo wings for the price of one.  I'd give the wings a B+ but definitely worth what we paid for them.  Please, Fridays, get this location some help because they are ruining your name!

The manager Joe came over and apologized for all the troubles, he gave us a few $5 gift cards and said that they were just very busy. He bought me a beer that took almost a half hour to come. I also must mention that all 3 steaks were on the bill.  We decided to go back when it wasn't as busy and it was the same thing!   A dirty restaurant, Steak well done, cold fries, mushy veggies, and the waiter Dennis brought my sons ice cream melted all over the sides of the dish (I wish I took a pic).  And again both steaks were on the bill! If you do decide to visit this disaster of a restaurant- CHECK YOUR BILL!!
By far best fridays ive been too....happy hour hrs are the best drinks come out really good...

I've been coming here since I moved in the area 4 years ago. Let me first start off by saying I have been a waitress before so I know the struggles of being asked to bring several things to different tables and trying to remember it all. It took 45 minutes to bring Jack Daniel Wings and my son's chicken fingers kids meal. Upon receiving this my son requested mash instead of french fries. We still received french fries but that was no biggie. We overlooked it, reminded him that I also asked for honey mustard as well and he brought the mash out right away. 20 minutes later he brought out my husbands other appetizer. I placed my order a little later than my husband and son but there is no way appetizers were taking so long. At this point I assume a friend of his came to visit so he not only talked to her but he also sat at their table. He then got up walked passed our table pivot... looked at the table went to the back and brought it out immediately. Still no honey mustard. I then asked for to go containers because we had been there for so long. He brought it out to us. If a table is asking for to go containers then you may want to bring the bill as well. Instead we waited another 15 minutes just for him to come back to the table and bring it. He then continued to converse and my husband ended up taking the bill to him.  Worst Service Ever. I ended up bringing all of  the food home. I wish I could have gotten a refund. DO NOT EAT HERE! GO TO GUNHILL RD.

WORST PLACE EVER!!!!! I went in with my husband  and 1 year old daughter 2 hours before they closed. We were seated in a booth and when asked for a high chair were told that they couldn't give us one because it was blocking the aisle which is understandable. The waitress pursued to move us to the table next to us where there was another waitress counting sugar packets, she told our waitress not to sit us there because she was going to leave and didn't want to do anything else. She then moved us to the other side where the waiter started cursing at the other employees, asking who the hell sat us there. He then proceeded to walk around the restaurant like he didn't notice us. He looked me dead in my eye a few times. He went around asking who the F sat us there. Everyone looked confused and nobody said anything. We sat there 25 mins and nothing not a word to us just kept walking around cussing up a storm. My husband didn't notice a thing because he was to busy looking at the menu. I got so tired at looking at this guy disrespect us talking smacking and ignoring us so I told my husband to let's leave and explained why. While we were putting on our jackets (40 mins after going in and being seated) the waiter had the audacity to ask us if we were okay. He was lucky I was with my daughter and didn't want her to hear what I wanted to tell him. I WOULD NEVER COME HERE AGAIN!!!

the longest and worst service i have ever experienced in the history of sunday afternoon dining!  the staff was very unprofessional starting with the blonde hostess in the front. she was disgusting and rude!  i will never return to this establishment again.

Don't do it! My fiance and I went there at 3 PM on a Saturday and will never be back. There was only one poor kid serving the entire bar area, which was completely full. Loaded Potato Skins were like deep friend mush with charred remnants of cheese on top. The wings were def frozen and looked like they just had some sauce dumped on them. Plus, they came with two sad looking pieces of celery and no dressing. Even when we requested Ranch it never came. Our drinks took 20 minutes to be delivered & there was a deep fried shrimp tail underneath my fries. Completely unacceptable, the manager took my meal off the bill, but I wish we never went. The food was barely edible only because we were absolutely starving.

That 2-for-10 may sound like a good deal, but let me tell you, friend, it is not! Food always comes out cold, and taste like it was previously frozen. Can anyone explain why this place is still in business? I mean, the times I went it was jammed packed.  Service was decent, but they really need to FIRE their cooks.
I've been to TGI Fridays twice, service and food was good, i will be back

This place gets no score (but yelp forces me to give a 1).  Went today for a party of 7 they said 20 minute wait.  No problem.  They take us to a booth that barely fits 4.   We complained and even another waitress agreed that that table is too small.  The waiter takes us to an outdoor eating area where the sun is beating down on me and my family.  My aunt and mom both in their mid 60s didn't want to feel the heat.  I asked him please find us something inside.  He comes back and says you will have to wait 45 minutes.  I asked him why since the original wait for a party of 7 was 20 mins.  They ended up giving the table that was for us to someone else.  I didn't get an apology from them.  I just left.  Never again will I go to this Fridays.  Management was non existent.  I've been to Fridays that had hour waits and extremely busy and never had this issue.  There were plenty of empty table but none close to each other that they can put them together.

I don't know about you, but I like it when my table is clean and not sticky when I sit down and wait for my food! The customer service here sucks! The food sucks and also, I wasn't aware that an entree comes before an appetizer! What kind of crap is that?

Okay so when we first arrived we noticed that the hostess left from the front counter. So thinking okay cool she will be back in a few. We waited about 10 min to be seated and thats only after the lady behind us went and flagged down a employee. A couple of employee's passed the group by clearly no concern for their business or any kind or a tip. After the girl returns she never apologizes for making us wait. She then starts walking really fast like she being chased to seat us.She never welcomes us to fridays makes eyes contact or nothing. She seats us at a table that was dirty and broken. So at this point we took it upon ourselves to move to another table. At this point we are left with dirty menus that are sticky. Sanitize sanitize sanitize the guys comes takes our order cool smooth sailing. Then the food comes SMH Why are my sliders burnt 2 out three and dry talk about over cooked. Only 1 burger was good and cooked properly. It took extremely to long to get the check. My friends steak was overly cooked she stated she would chew it like gum. There never cleared the plates from the table.  The service here was very disappointing for the price they charge. The service I received here was like eating at a self service buffet. Sorry no disrespect to buffet owners.

This is by far the worst TGI Fridays I have been to. Most of the staff is extremely rude and unprofessional. The first time we went our waiter was very nice. The second time we has a waitress who took 30 minutes to take our  orders. We waited about 50 minutes for our appetizer to come out and 10 minutes later our food came out cold. That same day their "system" was down and we received hand written checks that took another 40 minutes to get. At no point was our waitress or the boss supportive of the situation. She would walk by the table and not even ask if we needed anything.  The third time I decided to go, the "hostesses" in the front were extremely rude and literally yelling when asking us a party of how many and if we would stay...I must say Fridays doesn't have the best service but this by far is the worst.

Newer less smelly than the other Friday's the Buffalo Wings and Sliders are tasty. I was a little disappointed with my Electric Lemonade the glass was full of ice a.k.a. the drink was NOT strong and I didn't even get a buzz hello! We sat at the bar...

Compared to other Fridays I've been to this one is more appealing to the eyes. It's not that the other ones aren't clean, I've never been disappointed with the other ones. This one is just 'pretty' for lack of a better word. The layout is nice, and it is relatively new so I'm sure that adds to the ambience. I've been eating at Fridays for years and I typically have great meals. Off the top of my head I can't really think of a time that I've been immensely disappointed and that's including any of the locations. Well, maybe except 42nd street where the prices are ridiculously high and the quality of the food is not better than any of the other places. FYI This review is just for the dining experience, I don't know what their bar service/options is like.

Loved the service, all staff personnel seemed to work well with one another. Place was clean, food was pretty good....I ordered Shrimp with linguine, It was good, but I really wished that they had removed the shell.  It was such a bother just trying to get the shell off.  And biting into one of them was even worst!  Other then that, it was pretty good.  Our waiter William was awesome, he was very and I mean very courteous, attentive and conducted himself professionally.  Bravo William, you are what I call an exception to the rule.  You really went out of your way to make sure our lunch was a pleasant one.   Thank you.  Other staff were and seemed pleasant as well.
Server Zach is THE MAN. Food is the same as you'll get at any TGIF
I only nosh at the bar and get food to go. When I do eat, the food is average. The bartenders are cool though. One in particular is JAZZ. Happy hour can get crowded on Thursdays and Fridays.

It's Friday's.  The service here though is SO SLOW.  I've been there twice in the last couple of weeks and each meal took 2+ hours.  We had kids with us, it's simply crazy to have to wait 20 minutes for the appetizer, have our desserts delivered with the ice cream half-melted, and have to beg for refills and the check.  I will avoid going back.

worst experience ever.. waited 30 min for our appitizers then all of our food came out at the same time.. salads and the main coarse but no appitizers we ordered.. we waited 15 min to get service then after a total of the 30 min for the food then it all came out at once was not worth the wait.. left and went home ordered chinese and it was delviered within 20 min.. tgi fridays at cross county worst service ever.. manager didnt even offer to comp anything .. just to make us wait and bring out the appitizer and then the food late.. poor poor management..

Worst experience in attitude and management ever! I came in as a party of four to grab something to eat and it was fairly empty as it was after 10pm. We ordered our initial round of drinks straight off from our first of three waiters we would have that evening....our drinks came 25 minutes later and I noticed an insect floating in the top of my drink! I asked to see the manager whose name was Angel and he shrugged it off stating "oh that's just a bar gnat"..  what!!! He didnt look surprised or upset and said it happens all the time! (Btw it was not a gnat) He took it to be replaced and I proceeded to eat my entire meal before my drink came back from the bar. At that point I wasn't intrested in having it so I told the waiter number 3 to cancel it and it miraculously showed up. We asked for the check and it comes the the late bug infected drink not only charged but double billed! When pointed out and asked (because I was clearly not offered) for some sort of compensation for the wait and the drink the manager incredulously told me he replaced the drink so what's the problem! I for one work very hard for my money and will never again waste it here on bad service from a dirty establishment with a staff of bad attitudes and no care about customer service !!

Happy hours not so happy.  Always understaffed during happy hours which results in extremely poor and slow service. The food is actually good when not that many people. But the quality of food is compromised when the restaurant gets full. I rather pay the 50% off for better service and better food.

Seated right away but service overall was horrible. We ordered the loaded potato skins and asked for the bacon to be extra extra crispy and when it came out the bacon was basically raw. The same thing happened with the bacon and bleu burger. I got a regular cheeseburger and it had a piece of meat wrapper still attached to the burger.  From the time we got our appetizers it took about 20 minutes for our burgers to come out and the place wasn't even busy. The waitress didn't come back to see if we needed anything until 10 minutes after we were done eating. Not going back there again!!!!
The service is very slow, however they food is great as always.  They do not have the 2 for $10 deal, but they have happy hour all day on Sundays!

This review is not based on the food, the food is really good. This review is for the service that I received at this Fridays location. First off, I ordered a margarita and when I got this watered down margarita, but given that a lot of restaurants water down their alcoholic drinks I didn't  make a big fuss about it. My problem was with my waiter, my friend and I ordered the 2 for 10 with the entree and appetizer after 20mins of waiting some chick (not our waiter) brings out the entree,  were like "where is the appetizer? That's suppose to come first" She said "oh you want me to bring it back?" No! Sweetie just bring the appetizer out and we will eat both.. 5mins later our waiter comes out saying "I didn't even kno they brought out the food" fast forward after laughs with my friend, some other waiter brings out the check, that we never asked for and what made it funny was that the check that she gave us wasn't even ours! Then when we are ready to leave, our waiter is too busy flirting with the other table to give us our check and take our money so that we can leave. We waited 20 mins for him to take out our check.. And he expected a tip???? Yea right.. I will try this place again because maybe it was a one time thing, but yea that was my experience there.

Fridays in Cross County opens on Monday! I am here today for free food as part of staff training. Whats not to like about a new over eager staff and familiar food in a spanking new venue. The ambience is nice and open and the bar is bigger. Def. an upgrade from the location on central avenue. Lets hope the hood from Y.O stays away.lol

bad service...there were more waiters than customers and still we waited for like 45 minutes for our orders to be served... the waiters didn't even bother to refill our glasses with water, and they were just standing a foot away from our table, chatting.. we asked for some jack daniel sauce which were not served as part of our jack daniel order and it took another 10 minutes for one of the waiters to give it to us... definitely not going back to this location

Service SUCKS! Once you get seated you have to wait atleast 20 minutes for someone to even come over to your table and be greeted! And trust me, this is not a one time thing. I have been there atleast 10 times and 8 out of the 10 - I experience the horrible service. I believe in second chances but I have given up with this restaurant. The one in scarsadale- I have no complaints about!

Had an early dinner there about a few weeks ago and liked the service, everyone was nice and serviceble. Our waiter was a plus being very attentive. Waited less than an hr to be seated which was nice. The food was good and so were the drinks we ordered. They retained their taste thru the meal. I will go back on my next visit to the mall.

It was a crowded Saturday evening, and a party of three was pleasantly surprised to find their estimated 15 minutes wait cut down to less than 10. The server was pleasant and friendly. The wait for the meals was a bit long. The alcoholic mango drink that one of the party ordered tasted watered down with only a faint taste of mango. The requested medium rare rib eye was not as rare as that one in the party liked, but she liked the sauce. The other two in the party did not care for the sauce. The potato strips with a sour cheesy sauce were pretty good, and so were the vegetables. The fries were a bit salty but still good. A second rib eye dish was ordered with a specific request to make it medium rare a bit rarer. Another long wait, and the server was less attentive, busy with the other customers. The second rib eye dish - well, it was practically a disaster. The vegetables were way too salty. The potato strips barely had any of the cheese sauce on it. And the rib eye? Despite the request to make it rarer, it was more on the medium well done side. At least a third of it was plain fat. And the sauce that the one had liked was practically nonexistent. When the server finally came to ask if all was satisfactory, a polite complaint was made. The party had had a coupon that would have made the cheaper rib dish free. Instead, the second rib eye dish was free. At least that was something. For the writer, the establishment gets 2 stars. She would not mind coming back. For that one? She was very, very unhappy.
